revised_title: Experimental Researches on the Electrical Conductivity of Ice and Other Substances
tldr: Faraday discovered that ice is a non-conductor of electricity and that the electrical conductivity of a substance changes when it transitions from a liquid to a solid state. He demonstrated this by conducting experiments with ice, water, and other fusible substances using a voltaic battery and a galvanometer. This finding has important implications for understanding the behavior of electricity and electrochemical reactions.
